li.a: Staff Resources During Extended School Closure
Student and Family Resource for Support

span.style: caret-color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-weight: bold; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

span.span: Stay tuned for video updates from Superintendent Ritchie.
span.strong: Below you willfind the most up to date

div.style: font-size: 10px; color: #cccccc;line-break: anywhere;word-break: normal;overflow: hidden;white-space: nowrap;text-overflow: ellipsis; font-family: Interstate,Lucida Grande,Lucida Sans Unicode,Lucida Sans,Garuda,Verdana,Tahoma,sans-serif;font-weight: 100;

br.p: Good afternoon, members of the New London School Community,

I hope everyone is safe and healthy.We miss you!The classrooms, hallways, offices, and athletic fields are missing student and faculty voices, laughter, cheer, learning, problem solving and collaboration. I am a believer that there are always positive learning opportunities that come out of every crisis. One such lesson that has clearly shone through for me through this health crisis so far has been the importance and value of human interactions. Connecting with people face-to-face is such a gift!

The district will be transitioning to a more visual approach of communication in hopes to connect directly with all constituents. Today is the first of many video clips that will be published. All should expect such communication sent to them, via phone, text and email, each Friday. In order to receive district messages and important information, you must have an up-to-date phone number on record in PowerSchool.Click Hereare directions to opt in for text messaging.If you need to change additional information such as email or phone number, please contactpshelpdesk@newlondon.org.

SHOUT OUTs:I wish to share a shout out to so many staff, students and families for their support and excellence in supporting student learning, social emotional needs, food delivery service and the intense sanitizing of our buildings by our custodial team. Over 50,000 interactions between students and faculty have occurred through Distance Learning in 4 weeks already.Thank you, thank you, thank you!You are appreciated!
SCHOOL CALENDAR:As of today, our schools are closed until at least May 20th. Governor Lamont will make the decision to extend school closures or not, and we expect to hear an update from him soon.

ACADEMIC UPDATES:Department leaders are in place for all content areas. These leaders are setting the direction for teachers and for students regarding academic expectations per week.Please (Click Here) to access the chart of the names of these department leaders and their contact information. Teachers will continue to give directions to students of their assignments for the week by Monday morning, in addition please visit the following links below to view our Distance Learning expectations for next week.

EXTENDED LEARNING FOR STUDENTS AND FAMILIES:We are pleased to bring forward a new learning opportunity. This workshop is about how to keep students safe from sexual predators when online. The workshop flyer ishere. Please sign up to participate in learning about this virtually. Parents, please decide if your children should accompany you to learn about these important safety tips.

GRADUATIONS:We are working with students, staff, and families on ideas for both a virtual graduation ceremony and a possible future, live ceremony. These discussions will continue over the next several weeks. Parents can plan on having some type of celebration to honor transitioning students moving from grades 5 to 6, 8 to 9 and graduation for grade 12. More information to come soon.

GRADING:At this time, all students are expected to log into their online learning platform and complete their assigned work, Monday through Friday. Their log in and time spent online is being monitored and counted towards attendance. In addition, teachers will continue to share online feedback with students on their effort and work completion. If students need immediate assistance, they should communicate such with their teacher so additional supports can be added. More information regarding how the quality and accuracy of student work will be evaluated will be shared soon. Districts are working together to define a grading system.

SUMMER SCHOOL:We are planning on having summer programs begin on July 13th. These are being planned for, both, in person and via online programs based on the current status of the health crisis the world is facing.Parents of students who will be invited to attend summer school programming will receive an email and a phone call notifying them of such invitations.

RESOURCES:Please remember that we have posted a variety of resources offering help to you and your family regarding COVID-19, food shortages, health needs, mental health needs, etc. Pleaseclickhereto find these. We, the school district, multiple town departments and community agencies are here to help.Please do not hesitate to contact us at any time.

HIGHLIGHTING WHAT REALLY MATTERS:I end todays message grounding us in the focus of why we are here. We are here to serve CHILDREN, who I coin the worlds most valuable resources!Look at the genuine gems surrounding us.Students you are amazing!

div.script:
$(document).ready(function () {
        var logConsole = function (str) {
            console.log(str);
        };
        if ($('#tabPortlet_570724 .divTabEdit').val() == "True") {
            var isModern = ('True');
            if(isModern.toLowerCase() == "true")
            {
                var tabObj = $('#tabPortlet_570724 ');
                var tabM = $('#ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl18_divTabs').attr('portlet') == 'tab';

                function activate() {
                    $(tabObj).scrollingTabs({                 
                        tabs: [{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl18_divTabs_0","title":"Superintendent Letters to Families and Community","content":"\n
\nSuperintendent's Communication for Students, Staff and Families (3-27-2020).pdf\n\nSuperintendent's Communication for Families (March 24th) PDF.pdf
\n

\n
\nCOVID-19 Letter to Families 3-17-20.pdf
\n
\nCOVID-19 Letter to families 3-13-20.pdf
\n
\nAddendum to COVID-19 Letter 3-13-20.pdf
\n
\nCOVID19 Letter-March 12,2020.pdf
\n
\nCOVID19 Letter-March 12,2020 Spanish.pdf
\n
\nCOVID19 - Letter to School Community 3-10-20.pdf
\n
","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl18_divTabs_1","title":"Academic Plans","content":"Academic Plan - PreK-5 3-27-20.pdf
\n
\nPlan Academico - PreK-5 3-27-20 - Spanish Version.pdf
\n
\nAcademic Plan - 6-12 3-27-20.pdf
\n
\nPlan Academico - 6-12 3-27-20 - Spanish Version.pdf","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl18_divTabs_2","title":"COVID-19 Resources","content":"COVID-19 Parent Handout.pdf
\n
\nUpdated Technology Family Letter.pdf
\n
\nCarta para padres Actualizacion de Tecnologia.pdf
\n
\nTips To Talking With Children.pdf
\n
\nSpanish - talking to children about covid.pdf
\n
\nSpanish - How to deal with isolating at home.pdf
\n
\nLedge Light COVID-19 Reference.pdf
\n
\nLedge Light COVID-19 Reference - Spanish.pdf
\n
\nLedge Light COVID-19 Reference 2.pdf
\n
\nLedge Light COVID-19 Reference 2 - Spanish.pdf","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl18_divTabs_3","title":"Survey Responses","content":"\n
Superintendent's Communication for Students Staff and Families (4-7-2020).pdf
\n
\nSuperintendent's Communication - Families Spanish (4-7-2020).pdf\n
Superintendent's Communication for Students Staff and Families (4-3-2020).pdf
\n
\nLetter for Students Staff and Families Spanish 4-3.pdf\nSurvey Responses 3-20-20 through 3-23-20.pdf
\n
\nSurvey Responses 3-18-20 & 3-19-20.pdf
\n
\nSurvey Responses 3-17-20.pdf
\n
\nSurvey Responses through 3-16-20.pdf","active":false,"disabled":false}],// required,
                        propPaneId: 'paneId', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propTitle: 'title', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propActive: 'active', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propDisabled: 'disabled', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propContent: 'content', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        tabMode : tabM,
                        scrollToTabEdge: false, // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        disableScrollArrowsOnFullyScrolled: false // optional- pass in default value for demo purposes
                    }).on('ready.scrtabs', function() {
                        $('#'+this.id+' .tab-pane').attr('tabindex',0);
                    });
                };

                activate();
            }
        }
    });

span.style: caret-color: rgb(51, 51, 51); color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

div.span: Our district website has an active COVID-19 survey through which parents, students, staff and community members may submit their questions or concerns. We will be receiving and responding to a variety of questions daily. These responses will be updated and posted on our website, www.newlondon.org. Please use the survey link here:

h3.style: font-size: 14pt; caret-color: rgb(51, 51, 51); color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: "Open Sans", sans-serif; text-align: center;
